definition: extroverted/outgoing/to play audio through speakers (rather than through earphones)/(old) to appoint to a post outside the capital
to put/to place/to release/to free/to let go/to let out/to set off (fireworks)

sentences.english: A. Wendy, I don't like my outgoing message, you do one for you.
sentences.chinese: 我不喜欢我的外放电话留言，你来给我设一个。

sentences.english: Never leave perishable food out of the refrigerator for more than two hours;
sentences.chinese: 绝不要把能变坏的食品在冰箱外放超过两小时。

sentences.english: The Lion is too outgoing and you are far too sensitive.
sentences.chinese: 狮子过于外放，鱼儿则太敏感。

sentences.english: Any exposed chemicals or improper chemical storage?
sentences.chinese: 有外放或存放不当的化学物品吗？

sentences.english: It was to explore the American option that Mao recalled four Army marshals from exile.
sentences.chinese: 正是探索美国这一选择，毛召回了四位外放元帅。

definition: to use fully/to put to use
to do two things at once (idiom)/to multitask/to divide one's attention
simple and honest/unsophisticated/(music etc) deep and resounding
to dwindle/to vanish/to make vanish/to exercise restraint/to curb (one's mirth, arrogance etc)/to astringe/(math.) to converge
to implement the law/to perform sorcery
to constrict/to draw tight/to gather (one's thoughts)/to bring to a close/to pack (for a journey)
